content:
Am I missing something or don't we have an existing issue to add a date field type to core? https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/date

<input type="date">
input elements of type="date" create input fields that let the user enter a date, either with a textbox that validates the input or a special date picker interface.
This seems (for my browser at least) like it would negate the need for the 'popup calendar' widget...
And better support for mobile (which is why I'm looking into it)
Gonna create one then. point out an existing issue if I missed it.

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4733

Add native widget to Date field 路 Issue #4733 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need There exists an HTML input type: date which provides native support for date fields, with a popup calendar, for modern browsers and mobile devices: https://developer.mozilla...
@indigoxela might recall if there was a follow-up
